revised_title: The Role of Attractive Force in Combustion and the Emission of Light
tldr: The author, Mr. Morgan, conducted experiments on the light emitted by burning bodies and found that the attractive force between the rays of light and the body affects the colors and intensity of the flame. The least attractive force allows the most refrangible rays to escape first, resulting in a blue flame. As the heat increases, more rays are released, eventually creating a white flame. This phenomenon can be observed in various combustible materials and helps explain the colors and behavior of flames during combustion.
